title: Danielle Lloyd makes thinly-veiled dig at Rebekah Vardy after wading into Coleen Rooney spat
text:

Danielle Lloyd quickly managed to involve herself in the Rebekah Vardy and Coleen Rooney spat, announcing she was firmly Team Coleen.

And the former WAG, 35, is milking the drama for all it's worth as she made a thinly-veiled dig at Rebekah on Instagram last night.

She posted a picture in which she sported a baggy jumper that she'd pulled down to flaunt her cleavage and pulled a mega pout for the camera.

Danielle, who was married to Jamie O'Hara, captioned the post: "Don’t let negative people spoil your day."

Her comment came after a day of rowing with Rebekah, 37, over her denial that she didn't sell stories on Coleen, 33.

(Image: Instagram)

(Image: Lia Toby/WENN.com)

And Danielle's Instagram followers clearly got the reference.

One commented: "Love your loyalty towards @coleen_rooney you have morals, and not afraid to voice them, even if you then face negativity yourself! You go girl."

"Deffo on about Ms Vardy xxx," another posted.

A third joked: "Is that really you tho.. or has your account been hacked too? #convenient."

(Image: PA)

It all kicked off when Coleen publicly accused someone using Rebekah's account of taking posts from her private Instagram and selling them to the press.

She said she'd had suspicions that it was her and so blocked everyone from viewing the posts except Rebekah's account to see if the posts leaked - and they did.

Rebekah denied selling stories, claiming that her Instagram account had been hacked.

(Image: Twitter)

Danielle waded into the row when she said she believed Rebekah was behind the leaks because she'd had "run-ins" with her.

She said on This Morning: "It's definitely come out of Becky's account. I think she did it. Sadly I really do. It's a shame as she probably didn't think she was going to get caught out."

Rebekah was furious, branding her a liar and saying she had begged her to find her a husband like Jamie Vardy.
description: Danielle is milking the drama for all it's worth as she spoke about 'negative people' in a selfie caption last night
